City Council

Council Meetings

Mill Creek City Council welcomes and encourages all interested parties to attend City Council Meetings.

Regular meetings are held at 6:00 p.m. on the first, second, and fourth Tuesday of each month in Council Chambers. If you need special accommodations, please call the City Clerk at 425-921-5728 three days prior to the meeting. 

To participate in person: Mill Creek City Hall, 15728 Main St., Mill Creek, WA 98012 
To participate online: Follow the link below to learn how to use our City Council Online Portal and join via Zoom or YouTube.

Council Calendar and Meeting Agendas Join on Zoom Watch Live on YouTube City Council Meeting Recaps
  • Previous Meeting Agendas
  • Meeting Minutes
  • Resolutions
  • Ordinances
  • Proclamations
  • Interlocal Agreements

Meet Your Councilmembers

The Mill Creek City Council establishes policies through the adoption of ordinances, resolutions, and directives to achieve the City's vision and mission. Through its legislative actions, the Council establishes priorities for the City Manager and staff. The Council consists of seven members elected at-large to four year terms. Every two years, the City Council elects from its members the Mayor, who serves as chairperson, and the Mayor Pro Tem, who assumes mayoral responsibilities in the Mayor's absence. The Council also appoints a City Manager to carry out the policies and priorities that the Council adopts. The City Manager is the Chief Executive Officer of the City.

Mayor Brian Holtzclaw

Mayor
Position 4

With a background in real estate development law, Mayor Brian Holtzclaw has been interested in land-use and development issues for years.

Mayor Pro Tem Stephanie Vignal

Mayor Pro Tem
Position 2

Mayor Pro Tem Stephanie Vignal's focus is to ensure that Mill Creek continues to be a welcoming, thriving, and safe community for all its residents.

John Steckler

Position 1

Councilmember Steckler and his wife fell in love with Mill Creek when they were looking for a place in which to raise their family.

Connie Allison

Position 3

Councilmember Connie Allison is an eleven-year resident of Mill Creek and a lifelong resident of Western Washington.

Vince Cavaleri

Position 5

Councilmember Cavaleri's service stems from a desire to be a fiscal representative for the community; he strives to ensure the City provides a superior level of service without implementing high taxes.

Melissa Duque

Position 6

Councilmember Melissa Duque is committed to ensuring Mill Creek continues to be a community where people feel safe, have access to green spaces, and where residents and businesses flourish.

Sean Paddock

Position 7

Councilmember Paddock is dedicated to a Mill Creek that is safe, prosperous and vibrant, offering a high quality of life for all of usresidents, businesses and visitors.

Legislative Committee

The Legislative Committee's Agenda includes support for Infrastructure & Capital Projects, Land Use & Growth Management, Public Safety, Transportation, and Public Records Reform. Learn more at the link below. 

Learn More

Written Public Comment

Written comments will be distributed to Councilmembers when received in writing by 4:00 p.m. on the day of the Council Meeting. If received after the deadline, comments will be distributed at the next Council Meeting. 

Written Public Comment Form

City Council Event Request

Thank you for considering the Mill Creek City Council to participate in your event. Fill out the form below to submit an event request to ask a councilmember to attend your event. Please note that we are not able to guarantee availability for any specific date. For additional information, contact cityclerk@millcreekwa.gov.

City Council Event Request Form
